CONCLUSION: No violation of Article 5 - Right to liberty and security (Article 5-1 - Lawful arrest or detention;Article 5-1-f - Expulsion;Article 5-4 - Review of lawfulness of detention)
TEXT: CARDINAL . The applicant , a NORP national , was born in DATE and currently resides in GPE , GPE .

CARDINAL . On DATE the applicant arrived in GPE , being in possession of a study visa . He enrolled in the ORG and had his registered residence in the town of Izhevsk . His visa expired on CARDINAL DATE .

CARDINAL . On CARDINAL DATE the applicant applied for refugee status alleging the risks to his life and safety in the light of the on - going conflict in GPE . The request and the subsequent appeals were dismissed by the NORP migration authorities and the courts .
CARDINAL . On DATE the applicant was arrested and put in detention by the migration authorities .

CARDINAL . By a judgment of CARDINAL DATE ORG found the applicant in breach of migration rules , an offence under LAW of LAW , and ordered his expulsion . In order to facilitate enforcement , the court ordered that the applicant be placed in detention .
CARDINAL . On DATE ORG of GPE upheld the lower court ’s judgment .

CARDINAL . On DATE the ORG indicated to the respondent Government , under LAW , that the applicant should not be extradited , expelled or otherwise involuntarily removed from GPE to GPE for the duration of the proceedings before the Court . Since that date the enforcement of the applicant ’s expulsion was DATE postponed by the domestic courts .
CARDINAL . On DATE ORG of GPE on appeal amended the lower courts’ judgments and excluded administrative removal from the sanction , since it would have exposed the applicant ’s life to risk in GPE .
CARDINAL . On DATE the applicant left GPE for GPE .
